<QuestionSource url="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2026_Lamag_by-election">
## Summary of 2026 Lamag By-Election Article

**Disclaimer:** The article appears incomplete — notably, the Results section and Timeline section contain no data, suggesting the Wikipedia page was either not fully populated at the time of extraction or the election had not yet occurred/results had not been recorded.

### Key Facts

- **Seat:** Lamag, Sabah State Legislative Assembly
- **Scheduled Date:** January 24, 2026
- **Reason Called:** Death of incumbent MLA Bung Moktar Radin on December 5, 2025 (kidney failure and lung infection)
- **Concurrent Election:** Held alongside the 2026 Kinabatangan parliamentary by-election (Bung also held that federal seat)

### Constituency Demographics
- 86.0% Muslim Bumiputera, 13.6% non-Muslim Bumiputera, 0.40% Chinese

### Candidates/Nominations
- **BN:** Ismail Ayob (had run as independent in the 2025 Sabah state election, finishing second behind Bung by only 153 votes)
- **Warisan:** Mazliwati Abd Malek
- **GRS:** Chose **not** to contest out of respect for Bung
- **Perikatan Nasional:** Also chose **not** to contest either by-election

### No information** regarding any legal challenges, election petitions, or result annulments is present in the article.
</QuestionSource>
